Plot a given position weight matrix as a heatmap using ggplot2

Source: R/plot_ggheatmap.R
plot_ggheatmap.Rd

The given matrix is plotted as a heatmap using ggplot2's geom_tile.

plot_ggheatmap(pwmMat, position_labels = NULL, savePDFfilename = NULL)

Arguments

pwmMat

Matrix (usually a PWM, but can be non-normalized/any matrix) to be represented as a heatmap.
position_labels

Labels of the positions in the sequences.
savePDFfilename

Name of the file which will be saved as PDF.

Value

A ggplot object so you can simply call print or save on it later. If savePDFfilename is given, it is also saved and the ggplot object returned.

See also

plot_ggseqlogo for plotting PWMs as sequence logos

Other visualization functions: plot_ggseqlogo(), viz_basis_vectors_as_heatmap(), viz_basis_vectors_as_seqlogo(), viz_basis_vectors_in_combined_heatmaps_seqlogos(), viz_seqs_as_acgt_mat_from_ohe(), viz_seqs_as_acgt_mat_from_seqs()
